questions.question_text: When should the Data Preview feature be used?

choices.D: When previewing the data before searching.
choices.C: When validating the parsing of data.
choices.A: When reviewing data on the source host.
choices.B: When extracting fields for ingested data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The Data Preview feature in Splunk is used to validate how data is parsed before it is indexed

questions.question_text: A Splunk administrator has been tasked with developing a retention strategy to have frequently accessed data sets on SSD storage and to have older, less frequently accessed data on slower NAS storage. They have set a mount point for the NAS. Which parameter do they need to modify to set the path for the older, less frequently accessed data in indexes.conf?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In indexes.conf, the coldPath parameter is used to specify the path for the older, less frequently accessed data.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

questions.question_text: When working with an indexer cluster, what changes with the global precedence when comparing to a standalone deployment?

choices.D: The system default directory becomes the highest priority.
choices.C: The app local directories move to second in the priority list.
choices.B: The peer-apps local directory becomes the highest priority.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Precedence within global context, indexer cluster peers only
There is an expanded precedence order for indexer cluster peer configurations, which are considered in the global context. This is because some configuration files, like indexes.conf, must be identical across peer nodes.

To keep configuration settings consistent across peer nodes, configuration files are managed from the cluster manager node, which pushes the files to the peer-app directories on the peer nodes. Files in the peer-app directories have the highest precedence in a cluster peer's configuration. These directories exist only on indexer cluster peer nodes.

Here is the expanded precedence order for cluster peers:

1. Peer-app local directories -- highest priority
2. System local directory
3. App local directories
4. Peer-app default directories
5. App default directories
6. System default directory -- lowest priority

A user is assigned two roles with the following search filters. What is the userâ€™s applied search filter?

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think A (AND):
If you use OR, it would mean the user would receive access to all .csv files, even those outside of index=main. The index=main is designed to restrict the user to only the main index, using OR would make this irrelevant.

comments.content: Yes, i was thinking also, almost im using OR to search from multiple index

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When multiple search filters are assigned from different roles, Splunk combines them with an OR condition. This means the user will have access to data that matches either of the search filters.

questions.question_text: A company moves to a distributed architecture to meet the growing demand for the use of Splunk. What parameter can be configured to enable automatic load balancing in the Universal Forwarder to send data to the indexers?

choices.C: Set the tcpout :my_splunk_indexers stanza to have a server value equal to a comma-separated list of IP addresses and indexer ports for each of the indexers in the environment.
choices.B: Create one outputs.conf file for each of the server addresses in the indexing tier.
choices.A: Splunk does not do load balancing and requires a hardware load balancer to balance traffic across the indexers.
choices.D: Configure the outputs.conf file to point to any server in the indexing tier and Splunk will configure the data to be sent to all of the indexers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C.
The format will be:
[tcpout: my_LB_indexers]
server=10.10.10.1:9997,10.10.10.2:9996,10.10.10.3:9995
